alert.note: Alert for Eastern Preston; Preston; Ridges of Eastern Monongalia and Northwestern Preston; Western Tucker (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 6:27PM EST until December 25 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...WINTER STORM TO BRING LIFE-THREATENING COLD....STRONG TO DAMAGING WINDS...AND WINTER PRECIPITATION... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 1 PM EST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM FRIDAY TO NOON EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, flash freeze and snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph may result in visibility reductions in blowing snow. For the Wind Chill Warning, life threatening wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Pennsylvania. Portions of northern West Virginia. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 AM to 1 PM EST Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 AM Friday to Noon EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commutes. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. Life threatening, cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Keep pets indoors as much as possible. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
